what: Collection of R Functions for Statistical Analysis of Chiropractic Clinical Studies
title: Collection of R Functions for Statistical Analysis of Chiropractic Clinical Studies
text: See pkgdown site documentation.

title: Collection of R Functions for Statistical Analysis of Chiropractic Clinical Studies

what: Compute Confidence Intervals for Fixed Effects in a Linear Mixed Model — confint.rlmerMod
title: Compute Confidence Intervals for Fixed Effects in a Linear Mixed Model — confint.rlmerMod
text: function calculates confidence intervals fixed effects fitted linear mixed-effects model (class rlmerMod). intervals computed based estimated coefficients standard errors using normal distribution.

title: Compute Confidence Intervals for Fixed Effects in a Linear Mixed Model — confint.rlmerMod
code: # S3 method for class 'rlmerMod' confint(mod, parm, level = 0.95)

title: Compute Confidence Intervals for Fixed Effects in a Linear Mixed Model — confint.rlmerMod
text: mod fitted linear mixed-effects model object class rlmerMod. typically created using rlmer function robustlmm package. parm character vector specifying parameters (fixed effects) compute confidence intervals . missing, confidence intervals fixed effects computed. level numeric value 0 1 indicating confidence level intervals. default 0.95 95% confidence intervals.

title: Compute Confidence Intervals for Fixed Effects in a Linear Mixed Model — confint.rlmerMod
text: matrix confidence intervals specified fixed effects. row corresponds fixed effect, columns representing lower upper bounds confidence intervals.

title: Compute Confidence Intervals for Fixed Effects in a Linear Mixed Model — confint.rlmerMod
code: library(robustlmm) #> Loading required package: lme4 #> Loading required package: Matrix # Fit a linear mixed-effects model mod <- rlmer(Reaction ~ Days + (Days | Subject), data = sleepstudy) # Compute 95% confidence intervals for all fixed effects confint(mod) #>                  2.5 %    97.5 % #> (Intercept) 236.976956 265.48981 #> Days          7.455326  13.84218 # Compute 99% confidence intervals for specific parameters confint(mod, parm = "Days", level = 0.99) #>     0.5 %    99.5 %  #>  6.451878 14.845632

what: Diagonal plot for linear mixed effects models — diag.plot.lmer
title: Diagonal plot for linear mixed effects models — diag.plot.lmer
text: function creates diagonal plot linear mixed effects model using ggplot2 package. plot includes scatterplot residuals versus fitted values, Q-Q plot residuals, histogram residuals.

title: Diagonal plot for linear mixed effects models — diag.plot.lmer
Diagonal plot for linear mixed effects models — diag.plot.lmer
text: model linear mixed effects model created using lme4 package

title: Diagonal plot for linear mixed effects models — diag.plot.lmer
text: ggplot2 object representing diagonal plot

title: Diagonal plot for linear mixed effects models — diag.plot.lmer
code: library(lme4) model <- lmer(Sepal.Length ~ Sepal.Width + (1 | Species), data = iris) diag.plot.lmer(model)

what: Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
title: Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
text: function checks element data frame determine NaN (Number). returns logical matrix element TRUE corresponding element data frame NaN, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
text: x data frame checked NaN values.

title: Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
text: logical matrix dimensions input data frame, TRUE indicating NaN values FALSE indicating non-NaN values.

title: Check for NaN Values in Data Frame — is.nan.data.frame
code: df <- data.frame(a = c(1, NaN, 3), b = c(NaN, 2, NaN)) is.nan(df) #>          a     b #> [1,] FALSE  TRUE #> [2,]  TRUE FALSE #> [3,] FALSE  TRUE

what: Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
title: Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
text: function calculates standardized beta coefficients fitted linear mixed-effects model (using lmer function lme4 package). Standardized beta coefficients obtained scaling fixed effects coefficients standard deviations predictor variables outcome variable.

title: Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
text: mod fitted linear mixed-effects model object class lmerMod, typically created lmer function lme4 package.

title: Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
text: vector standardized beta coefficients corresponding fixed effects (excluding intercept) model.

title: Calculate Standardized Beta Coefficients from a Linear Mixed Model — lmer.std.beta
code: library(lme4) # Fit a linear mixed-effects model mod <- lmer(Reaction ~ Days + (Days | Subject), sleepstudy) # Calculate standardized beta coefficients lmer.std.beta(mod) #>      Days  #> 0.5352302

title: Standardize a Contrast Table — standard.ctt.table
text: function standardizes contrast table model summary statistics, including estimates, standard errors, confidence intervals, test statistics. adjusts column names formats results easy interpretation, providing concise representations differences test results.

title: Standardize a Contrast Table — standard.ctt.table
Standardize a Contrast Table — standard.ctt.table
text: raw.ctt.table contrast table model summary, typically containing columns estimates, standard errors, confidence intervals, test statistics. object can either contain asymptotic confidence limits, function detect handle accordingly.

title: Standardize a Contrast Table — standard.ctt.table
text: standardized data frame containing: Contrast name contrast tested. Difference±SE 95% CI Formatted difference estimates standard error confidence intervals. Test Formatted test statistic (either t z statistic), degrees freedom, p-value.

title: Standardize a Contrast Table — standard.ctt.table
text: function checks input table contains asymptotic regular confidence limits (asymp.LCL/asymp.UCL lower.CL/upper.CL). also detects whether use z.ratio t.ratio test statistic. final table provides concise summary contrasts, including estimates, standard errors, confidence intervals, test statistics, p-values, human-readable format.

title: Standardize a Contrast Table — standard.ctt.table
code: library(emmeans) #> Welcome to emmeans. #> Caution: You lose important information if you filter this package's results. #> See '? untidy' model <- lm(Sepal.Length ~ Sepal.Width + Species, data = iris) contrast_table <- emmeans(model, pairwise ~ Species)$contrasts result <- standard.ctt.table(contrast_table) print(result) #>                 Contrast   Difference±SE [95% CI]         t[df], p-value #> 1    setosa - versicolor    -1.5±0.1 [-1.7, -1.2] t[146]=-13.012, <0.001 #> 2     setosa - virginica    -1.9±0.1 [-2.2, -1.7] t[146]=-19.465, <0.001 #> 3 versicolor - virginica -0.49±0.09 [-0.7, -0.27]  t[146]=-5.409, <0.001

what: Standardize an Estimated Marginal Means (EMM) Table — standard.em.table
title: Standardize an Estimated Marginal Means (EMM) Table — standard.em.table
text: function standardizes table estimated marginal means (EMMs) model summary statistics. reformats EMM estimates, standard errors, confidence intervals, test statistics human-readable format.

title: Standardize an Estimated Marginal Means (EMM) Table — standard.em.table
Standardize an Estimated Marginal Means (EMM) Table — standard.em.table
text: raw.em.table table estimated marginal means model summary, typically containing columns EMM estimates, standard errors, confidence intervals, test statistics. function detect table contains asymptotic regular confidence limits.

title: Standardize an Estimated Marginal Means (EMM) Table — standard.em.table
text: standardized data frame containing: Estimate±SE 95% CI Formatted estimates standard errors 95% confidence intervals. Test Formatted test statistic (either t z statistic), degrees freedom, p-value.

title: Standardize an Estimated Marginal Means (EMM) Table — standard.em.table
text: function checks whether input table includes asymptotic regular confidence limits (asymp.LCL/asymp.UCL lower.CL/upper.CL) whether use z.ratio t.ratio test statistic. processes raw table returns user-friendly summary formatted estimates test statistics.

title: Standardize an Estimated Marginal Means (EMM) Table — standard.em.table
code: library(emmeans) model <- lm(Sepal.Length ~ Sepal.Width + Species, data = iris) contrast_table <- emmeans(model, ~Species) result <- standard.em.table(contrast_table) print(result) #>      Species   Estimate±SE [95% CI]         t[df], p-value #> 1     setosa 4.71±0.07 [4.56, 4.85]  t[146]=64.131, <0.001 #> 2 versicolor  6.17±0.07 [6.03, 6.3]  t[146]=89.294, <0.001 #> 3  virginica 6.65±0.06 [6.53, 6.78] t[146]=106.365, <0.001

what: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
title: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
text: function formats p-value standardized number significant digits. p-value smaller threshold (10^(-sigD)), returned "<0.001" (another appropriate threshold based sigD), otherwise, rounded specified number significant digits.

title: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
text: value numeric value representing p-value formatted. sigD integer specifying number significant digits retain. Default 3.

title: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
text: character string representing formatted p-value.

title: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
text: function takes p-value checks smaller certain threshold determined sigD parameter. p-value smaller threshold, returns string indicating value smaller threshold. Otherwise, p-value returned rounded specified number significant digits.

title: Format P-Value with Standardized Precision — standard.p.value
